title: Typographic Ts?
content:
I’d like to buy a t-shirt design from a typographer who knows what they’re doing because I like fonts, but I never buy font-only shirts at apparel outlets. It’s usually because their message is not original and the design is not original. Hopefully someone in this field of work can come up with a creative shirt to do with kerning, lorem ipsum, wingbats, or something that looks like a stylish tee for a typophile.

 [‹ Whitman Display](http://web.archive.org/web/20080320064334/http:/typophile.com/node/42142 "Go to previous forum topic") [Another nice Mexican Blackletter example ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080320064334/http:/typophile.com/node/42192 "Go to next forum topic")
author: BaB

comments.content:
Veer has some pretty creative stuff. My fav from threadless is actually really sick looking: [lorem ipsum](http://web.archive.org/web/20080320064334/http:/www.threadless.com/product/1144/Ketchup_And_Mustard)

I don’t like the type treatment on the bottles at all but whatever.

Anyone could type up Lorem Ipsum or the alphabet on an American Apparel shirt so I’m not going to pay Veer $20 a tee for them.

I knew I would see some helvetica tees, but at least Khoi Vinh’s Hel-\*\*\*\*-Vetica has a cool design. (not that I’d wear something with that language, but it’s still sold out anyways)

That Ketchup And Mustard t-shirt is headed towards the art direction I like, but it looks familiar to me and do all typographers use condiments? ;)  
I knew I’ve seen similar designs before.  
 [http://www.threadless.com/submission/85700/Lorem\_Ipsum\_Dolor\_Sit\_Amet](http://web.archive.org/web/20080320064334/http:/www.threadless.com/submission/85700/Lorem_Ipsum_Dolor_Sit_Amet "http://www.threadless.com/submission/85700/Lorem\_Ipsum\_Dolor\_Sit\_Amet")  
 [http://www.threadless.com/submission/92057/Lorm\_Ipsum\_Dolor\_Tubes](http://web.archive.org/web/20080320064334/http:/www.threadless.com/submission/92057/Lorm_Ipsum_Dolor_Tubes "http://www.threadless.com/submission/92057/Lorm\_Ipsum\_Dolor\_Tubes")  
and I like this design better (but I’m not going to wear something that says “selfless” on it)  
 [http://www.threadless.com/submission/73979/Selfless](http://web.archive.org/web/20080320064334/http:/www.threadless.com/submission/73979/Selfless "http://www.threadless.com/submission/73979/Selfless")

edit: After searching Threadless I came across what I think is the community’s best typography, [“E”-type!](http://web.archive.org/web/20080320064334/http:/www.threadless.com/submission/10706/E_type/showmore,designs).
